metadata.title: CVE-2020-14559 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Information Schema). Supported versions that are affected are5.6.48 and prior, 5.7.30 and prior and 8.0.20 and prior. Easily exploitablevulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQLServer accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.3 (Confidentiality impacts).CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
